executiveSummary: Aaron Krause from Philadelphia pitched his product, Scrub Daddy, seeking a $100,000 investment for 10% equity. After multiple offers and negotiations among the Sharks, Lori Greiner secured a deal with Aaron for $200,000 in exchange for 20% equity, promising rapid retail expansion and infomercial success.
keyDecisions: Aaron Krause accepted Lori Greiner’s offer of $200,000 for 20% equity in Scrub Daddy.

actionItems.task: Begin production and retail distribution partnership with Lori Greiner to expand Scrub Daddy into national retail and infomercial channels.
Coordinate QVC and infomercial rollout for Scrub Daddy under Lori’s guidance.

nextSteps: Aaron and Lori will collaborate to scale Scrub Daddy’s production and launch national retail and TV marketing campaigns, leveraging Lori’s QVC expertise.
